Standardize Multiple Variables for Composite Creation

Source: R/standardization.R
standardize_multiple.Rd

**L1 Internal Helper.** Batch standardization of multiple variables using the same method. Useful for creating composites from multiple items.

Usage

standardize_multiple(data, vars, method = c("z-score", "range", "scale"), ...)

Arguments

data

Data frame containing variables to standardize

vars

Character vector of column names to standardize

method

Character. Standardization method: "z-score", "range", or "scale"

...

Additional arguments passed to the standardization function (e.g., new_min, new_max for range/scale methods)

Value

List containing:

  • data: Data frame with standardized variables (original names)

  • meta: Named list with standardization metadata for each variable

Details

**What this does:** Applies the same standardization method to multiple variables at once, preserving metadata for transparency.

**Use case:** You have 5 items on different scales that you want to combine: “` result <- standardize_multiple( data = df, vars = c("item1", "item2", "item3", "item4", "item5"), method = "scale", target_min = 1, target_max = 7 ) df_std <- result$data # All items now on 1-7 scale “`

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Standardize multiple items to z-scores
df <- data.frame(
  item1 = c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5),
  item2 = c(10, 20, 30, 40, 50),
  item3 = c(100, 200, 300, 400, 500)
)

result <- standardize_multiple(
  data = df,
  vars = c("item1", "item2", "item3"),
  method = "z-score"
)

df_std <- result$data  # All items now z-scores

# Check metadata for each variable
result$meta$item1$original_mean
result$meta$item2$original_sd
} # }
